entry.title: MSM December Training (Combinatorics)
entry.content:
A short training organized by the mathematical society of Myanmar (MSM) for senior (Grade 10-11) students qualified for Myanamar national olympiads (now called MOMC). Contents include recurrence relations, recursive algorithms, counting with bijections, and proving combinatorial identities.

  • Lecture notes and slides
    • Recurrence Relations: pdf in Burmese, slides pdf, slides ppt
      Covers the idea of recursion in combinatorics such as setting up recurrences, chromatic polynomials and recursive algorithms such as merge-sort.
    • Bijective Counting: pdf in Burmese (unfinished), slides pdf, slides ppt
      Covers the usage of bijections to solve seemingly complicated counting problems and proving combinatorial identities using counting.
  • Videos: Day 1, Day 2, Day 3.
entry.summary: A short training organized by the mathematical society of Myanmar (MSM) for senior (Grade 10-11) students qualified for Myanamar national olympiads (now called MOMC). Contents include recurrence relations, recursive algorithms, counting with bijections, and proving combinatorial identities.

entry.title: Testing Stuff
entry.content: Let \(\mu\) be a \(\sigma\)-finite measure on \(X\). Suppose \(\lambda\) is a measure on $X$ that is absolutely continuous with respect to \(\mu\). Then, there exists \(f \in L^1(\mu)\) such that \[ \lambda(E) = \int_E f \,d\mu \] for all measurable sets \(E\).

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
Update 2.

မြန်မာလို ရေးလို့ရသလား။ မြန်မာနဲ့သင်္ချာ \(\varepsilon > \frac{3\pi\varepsilon_0}{4M}\)။

You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

Jekyll requires blog post files to be named according to the following format:

YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.MARKUP

Where YEAR is a four-digit number, MONTH and DAY are both two-digit numbers, and MARKUP is the file extension representing the format used in the file. After that, include the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.

Let \(\mu\) be a \(\sigma\)-finite measure on \(X\). Suppose \(\lambda\) is a measure on \(X\) that is absolutely continuous with respect to \(\mu\). Then, there exists \(f \in L^1(\mu)\) such that \[ \lambda(E) = \int_E f \,d\mu \] for all measurable sets \(E\).

entry.title: Euclidiad Level 1 (Junior) Short Course in Combinatorics and Geometry

link.title: Euclidiad Level 1 (Junior) Short Course in Combinatorics and Geometry

entry.content:
A very basic course on elementary counting oriented towards entry level olympiads such as AMC8/10, SASMO/SEAMO and junior level MOMC. This course covers standard material in elementary counting such as multiplication and addition principles in counting, permutations and combinations considered with or without repetitions. However, the problems are oriented more towards problem-solving rather than high school material.

Combinatorics: Lecture Slides and Videos

  • Lesson 1 - Basic Counting Principles: slides pdf
  • Video 1 - Lesson 1 on Steroids: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 2 - Permutations and Factorials: slides pdf
  • Video 2 - Fun Puzzles in Combinatorics: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 3 - Combinations: slides pdf
  • Video 3 - Overcounting and Circular Permutations: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 4 - Permutations with Repetitions: slides pdf
  • Video 4 - Stars and Bars Trick, Combinatorial Identities: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 5 - Probability: slides pdf
  • Video 5 - Review: slides pdf, video link

Combinatorics: Assignments

  • Homework 1: form link
  • Homework 2: form link
  • Homework 3: form link
  • Homework 4: form link
  • Homework 5: form link

Geometry: Lecture Slides and Videos

  • Lesson 1 - Areas and Ratios: slides pdf
  • Video 1 - Extra Problems on Areas: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 2 - Angles in Lines and Polygons: slides pdf
  • Video 2 - Extra Problems on Angles: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 3 - Right Triangles: slides pdf
  • Video 3 - More on Right Triangles: slides pdf, video link
  • Lesson 4 - Ratios and Similarity: slides pdf
  • Lesson 5 - Triangle Congruence: slides pdf

Geometry: Assignments

  • Homework 1: form link
  • Homework 2: form link
  • Homework 3: form link
  • Homework 4: form link
  • Homework 5: form link

This course covers standard material in elementary counting such as multiplication and addition principles in counting, permutations and combinations considered with or without repetitions. However, the problems are oriented more towards problem-solving rather than high school material.

entry.title: Intensive Training for 2022 Myanmar IMO Team (Combinatorics)

link.title: Intensive Training for 2022 Myanmar IMO Team (Combinatorics)

entry.content:
The name is self-explanatory. The content is just common problem solving techniques in olymmpiad combinatoircs such as the use of invariants, repeat-until-stuck algorithms, double counting and basic graph theory.

Lecture Videos and Slides

  • Lecture 1 - Monovariants: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 2 - Invariants: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 3 - Parity: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 4 - Induction: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 5 - Greedy Algorithms and Repeat-Until-Stuck: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 6 - Double Counting: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 7 - Polyhedron Formula : slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 8 - Counting in Graphs: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 9 - Injections and Bijections: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 10 - Pigeonhole Principle: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 11 - Discrete Continuity and Infinite Descent: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 12 - Colorings and WLOG: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 13 - Combinatorial Games: slides pdf, video link
  • Lecture 14 - Solutions to Mock Test and Problem Solving Philosophy: slides pdf, video not available

Problem Sets

  • Problem Set 1: pdf, solutions
  • Problem Set 2: pdf, solutions
  • Problem Set 3: pdf, solutions
  • Problem Set 4: pdf
  • Problem Set 5: pdf, solutions
  • Problem Set 6: pdf
  • Problem Set 7: pdf

Mock Test

  • Questions: pdf, AoPS link
  • Solutions to Combinatorics Problems: pdf
entry.summary: The name is self-explanatory. The content is just common problem solving techniques in olymmpiad combinatoircs such as the use of invariants, repeat-until-stuck algorithms, double counting and basic graph theory.
